title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with hiring manager and HR.  This was a prescreen call and only lasted 15-20 minutes.  There were many options to select a time that was available with the interviewers which was helpful.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you know about the Memorial Union (job was for Finance Role at Memorial Union)

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on job board on UW-Madison.  The interview was a group interview; first was a circuit style interview where you go around and each interviewer asks you a different question or makes you do a specific task (e.g answer a mock phone call, write a response to a sample email). Then we were split into smaller groups to do a teamwork exercise.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with customer service? How would you change your approach talking about technology than with other topics?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and panel interview in person.  Wanted to review experience in relation to the needs of the department.  culture and fit were a core area of focus along with expertise.  the position was a decentralized position supporting a department on campus.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IS Technical Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview as really technical. They asked a lot of technical questions. The interview can be difficult if you are not on top of your game. If you answer all the questions corectly and gave good exemple, you should be ok.
Interview Questions: To talk about a difficult customer I have dault with. The interview was really technical. They asked a lot of technical questions. I was screening by the whole interview panel and interview by the same people.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: 8.25 HOURLY prepare food customer service ask some question about the food service and you personal experience. It is university on campus part-time job every one can apply this position if you want.
Interview Questions: what is most important in you working experience

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I emailed a professor to see if he had any research that I could help out with. He asked for my resume which I sent in and that was about it. He directed me to his graduate student with whom I'd be working and we got in contact and set up a meeting to get me rolling.
Interview Questions: Can you send your resume?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sat down to lunch and talked a little bit about myself and my history in the workforce. My coworker at the time knew my current boss and believed I would be a good fit for the position as I was a female in the sciences. I also had aquatic husbandry experience, which helped with the specific project I am working on.
Interview Questions: What do you do at your current job and what is your work history

title: Student Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Non existent, you applied for and receive the job immediately as long as you were a student of the University of Wisconsin Madison. It was a very easy and streamlined process because they need people.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, we went over my grades and the reason why I want to be a tutor. The interview was fairly short and straightforward. The overall tone of the interview was light too.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a tutor?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I actually interviewed twice. The first time I think I came off as overbearing. We did a round-robin style interview by moving from cubicle to cubicle and either having a conversation with an employee or performing a task
Interview Questions: When was a time that you had a really good experience as a customer?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Serious of telephone interviews to determine statistical background and competency. Also, meeting the team in person for final round of interviews and description of the team and duties for the position being offered.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about the geographic location?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held at a resident hall. The directors were unorganized. The first thing that one of the interviewers told me was they did know anything about me. I lost interest in the position on the spot because they neither had my resume nor knew about me as a candidate.
Interview Questions: One question was a time when you had a problem, and how you solved it.

title: Senior IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with hiring manager and 2 other senior project managers in the department.  Interview lasted over an hour.  All three mangers were prepared and asked very good questions.
Interview Questions: What is the most important skill for a project manager.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: I send a letter to the lab that I'm interested to work there. I was invited and asked why I'm interested to do research in this area. Also I've been asked about my previous job and how well I did in high school. I had several questions relating to the power of my motivation.
Interview Questions: They gave me a paper and asked what experiments I'll run to figure out the influence of the molecule for cells.

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It's a very short process, lasting only for about 20 minutes. They are more interested in my teaching experience than my research, understandably.  They also ask for proof of past teaching evaluation, a 4.5 should get you through the first round.
Interview Questions: How do you help students who are less active?

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is a two hours process. We went through a group game, basically letting interviewers see our cooperation and communication skills. Then we were asked five questions about different aspects of help desk agent.
Interview Questions: How to let a five year old kid know computer science

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by a group interview with some team-working task, then lastly is a small-group interview. There is also a short presentation on the values of Rec Sports and you will be tested on it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Rec Sports?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Underwent two rounds of interviews during my final semester as an undergraduate at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. The interview process was stressful at moments, mostly because I had four interviews in a two hour time frame with various professors in biomechanics. I had to briefly describe relevant research and experiences. I had further interview discussions with my current PI afterwards. Total time commitment was about 4-5 months.
Interview Questions: Describe your undergraduate research experiences.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview process. Behavioral interview, simply review STARS method and you can expect to do very well. They are looking for very enthusiastic individuals who can inspire and work well with incoming students who may be nervous about first coming to college.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: phone screen 20 minutes. Asked general questions.Why do you leave the previous position? Why our company, why this position. when can you leave this position if you get hired?
Interview Questions: Why do you leave the previous position

title: Student Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Formal, but comfortable. They also took time to show me around the office before the interview which was a good ice breaker. The interview was a panel format. I was interviewed by 3 other project managers.
Interview Questions: What does sustainability mean to you?

title: PhD Graduate School Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online at the university website, an interested professor called me for a phone interview and I visited Madison for an in person interview.  Once I was accepted into the program the rest of the interviews were to find the lab I wanted to fit into.  It was a very easy process.
Interview Questions: What are my long term goals

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume, received a fairly quick email requesting an interview. Went in for the interview and spoke for about thirty minutes. The questions were your standard job interview fare. A few days after that I got a call offering me the job.
Interview Questions: What's an example of a time you had to deal with a challenge at a job and how did you manage it?

title: Facility Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: They emailed me to set up a phone interview. Once I had a phone interview, you proceeded to schedule an in-person, group interview. Once completed, you were selected for the job or not.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patron that is unsatisfied with something within our facilities?

title: Associate Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was particularly easy.  Brief e-mail correspondence, phone interview, and in person interview lasting roughly 1 hour. Lab tour.  Met one-on-one with the lab PI and was asked questions regarding my prior research experience, the paper I wrote, the skills I am familiar with, and why I wanted this job and why I felt I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: What was your research prior to this position? Why do you want to change research subjects?

title: Senior IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone panel interview with hiring director and two PMs. The second interview I was given a scenario in which I had to present how I would handle the situation to an audience of approximately 25 IT employees. Presentation was 15 minutes and there were many good questions which took another 15 minutes. Final interview was scheduled with VP however the process took so long I ended up taking a position with a different company.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict with a team member who does not report to you?

title: Student Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Variety of questions of background experience and future expectations. The entire team was present for my interview and the interview itself was very informal compared to others I had sat through. They asked well thought out questions to see if I would be a good fit both professionally as well as personally.
Interview Questions: Experience working with graduate students

title: House Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview is 2 hour long, has 2 parts. first a group interview, they gave us some interesting topics to discuss and observe our interactions. second is a standard panel individual interview. asked some standard questions.
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out?

title: Helpdesk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview with current students employed by the help desk. Round robin questions with each student followed by a teamwork exercise at the end. Overall it seemed easy going and more a test of social skills above anything else. There is no technical experience required.
Interview Questions: Give an example where you were provided excellent customer service.

title: Finance Specialist - Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with four members of staff, including the department chair.  Began with an overview of the department and then moved on to a more specific overview of the job.  Questions were all fairly easy, but they were all behavioral (instead of technical) and there were quite a few from each member of the panel.
Interview Questions: If you could change one thing about your last job, what would it have been?

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three employees in a pretty relaxed atmosphere. They asked questions like why I left my last job, what my availability was like, how my professors would describe me.
Interview Questions: How would a professor describe you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Send CV first; then talked about CV over phone; then proceeded to on-site interview with PI and senior lab members; presentation to lab members with Q and A; plans on future research work.
Interview Questions: What is your research background.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a great learning experience and had great theoretical questions about certain situations that were a bit challenging but if you have been in a similar situation then it was easier. The interviewers were also very kind.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to deal with a problematic customer and how you went about the situation.

title: Division of Information Technology - IS TECH SRV Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Longest interview process i've ever had. 45 days from apply to hire. Most of all.... Awkward. The managers at DoIT make everything awkward. All questions are asked with a blank expression with no follow-ups. Candidates must stick to the questions and are not allowed to showcase their skills or experience. Interviewers think they are psychologists and ask non-technical and non-relevant questions.
Interview Questions: Q: Greatest strengths, greatest weaknesses, have you ever worked on a team project, what is wi-fi.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Cooper City, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Excellent timing, quick and straightforward process. Super nice staff and hiring officials, even in initial stages. Flexible for scheduling. Very transparent about entire process. Would respond to quick email inquiries within 48 hours.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and lots of follow up questions based on the information I provided. There were some knowledge-based questions and many related to my experience doing some of the duties outlined in the position description.

title: Information Processing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Skype and onsite interview. Fairly standard but they really didn't understand my background or the job I'd be asked to do very well. As a result I'm not really happy in my job and looking forward to finding something new. Essentially, the technologically inept are running this place and a lot of efficiency could be gained through better paid tech employees.
Interview Questions:
Are you a self starter? 
Tell me about your previous jobs? Etc.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall, went very well. The interview was short and to the point. Nothing was too involved. We chatted about more than just the job and made it a conversation. The process was easy and I hope to have future interactions with them.
Interview Questions: Did I have experience with students.

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was your traditional student services interview.  They started off with a phone interview and invited me in for an on-campus interview with the staff, students, and campus partners.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three stages, extremely and unnecessarily long. Required panel interview, large group presentation, one-on-one interview, phone interview, presentation submission, large group Q&A.  Interview questions were redundant and each stakeholder group was looking for something different which was not obvious and often conflicted with each group, so really depended on who the decision makers were (actual decision makers) and whose feedback would garner the most weight, which was not readily made available.
Interview Questions: How would you work with a varied audience with many differing perspectives?  What is your 'vision' in this position?  What is your management style?  What is your project management experience?  What is your experience in developing learning programs?

title: Badgers Step Up Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick turnaround in submitting application and call for interview, as well as quick call for offering the job. Interviewers were the program directors, student manager and current employees. They gave a good feel for what the job was really like and excellent at answering questions.
Interview Questions: What experience I had in the past regarding facilitating large group discussions?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: it was a good interview process, they were interested in what I had to say. They asked easy to answer questions that actually pertained to the job. I knew several of the people that were interviewing me so I was more relaxed during the interview. They all shook my hand though to make it more professional.
Interview Questions: Describe your customer service experience?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application via email. They got back to me within 3 weeks and called me in for a formal interview. During the interview they asked me about my experience, if I had worked for the UW before, and if I would be okay with the wide range of tasks I could be assigned.
Interview Questions:
Are there any times you cannot work?
Have you worked for the UW before?
How did you hear about this position?
How would you answer a question you do not know the answer to?
Do you have any experience troubleshooting computers?

title: Resident Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: After an overview of experience and reviewing the Resume and Cover Letter they look into calling people for an interview. The interview is usually with more 3 people in a conference room
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in resident life issues ?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short, to the point, engaging, interesting, no stress. Everyone was very nice. Really, there's not a lot more to say but this says I have to write 50 words. The interview was cordial, good give-and-take, and respectful. I met with one person and then was introduced around. This was not part of a PA or RA position but just a position they had to fill from outside the college.
Interview Questions: How do you handle ambiguity?

title: AV Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial Phone Screen Interview going through a list of standard questions asking about my experience with technologies used in their rooms.  Followed by in person (group) interview to further go over my skills, experience, and my personality and how it matched with the team.
Interview Questions: Recommendations on room design to test my knowledge and thinking.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They advertised the open position online. I then submitted my application with references to them electronically. A few weeks later, they contacted me to set up an interview. The interview was a phone interview with a committee of 3 members who were professors. It lasted about 25 minutes. They asked basic questions and there were no real surprises.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have? Describe your teaching methods.

title: Graduate R Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather brief, and mostly a description of the research projects available for me.  The challenge here was to sell myself as a potential academic while still maintaining my intentions of pursuing industry related jobs.  However, that wasn't so much of a problem after we discussed potential projects.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to come earlier?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with department Administrator, Program Specialist, Manager for first round of interview, then with the addition of physicians and staff for second interview.  The people were very nice, and the interviews were primarily about experience and what my goals were.  For me, it felt like a good fit.  I was told after the second interview that I was one of two that was up for the job.  The manager was going abroad for the holidays and called before departure and told me to "hang in there" and  hoped to contact my references before she left, and if not, would have the Program Specialist do so while she was gone.  So I alerted my references about the upcoming contact and it never happened.  In addition, the week the manager returned I waited until the end of the week before contacting.  After sending an email, it was never returned.  I waited another week and sent another email which was finally returned by the manager...and was told that she did not return my previous email because she did not have the answers yet...I would have appreciated her telling me that rather than ignoring my email for a week.  I was told to wait again, and it was not for another nearly two weeks where a letter arrived in my mailbox that I did not get the position.  Managers should not say they are contacting references if they have no intention...it was a bit humiliating to give my references a heads up and them having to tell me they were not contacted.
The Administrative Program Specialist was very welcoming which I appreciated.  The physicians were wonderful as well as staff. The overall time of this process was about three months.
Interview Questions: Mainly about my experience and my forecast for the next 5 years.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor that posted an earlier job via e-mail.  The previous position was no longer available but she expected to be able to hire another person in the coming months, so we scheduled a time to meet in person. We remained in contact after the meeting and I was offered a job about 6 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions focused on if I would fit into the research group's style.

title: Student Employee - Bursar's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very conversational and was based on both personal information and scenario response to see how well you can respond to policies and solve problems that may arise in the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were considered trustworthy.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: After emailing inquiring about the job, I was contacted via email and invited to come in for a roughly 30 minute interview to discuss how my skills would fit in to the position in a relevant manor. There was also a lot of information given regarding what the job would consist of and if I had any aversions to things mentioned (mostly chemical work).
Interview Questions: How do your skills make you qualified for this position?

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. People are always graduating and leaving so the job needs a lot of help. If you show up to the interview you basically get it.
Interview Questions: When are you available to start

title: Digital Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very basic, asked about interest in the position and why I wanted it. Asked about what skills I had that I thought matched the job description.  The interviewer was very nice and wasn't trying to be intimidating in any way.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with Adobe software?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one conducted by phone with a short presentation up front and the other a day long event with multiple interviews and presentation required. The first was an interview with a search committee with the second set of interviews including a broad range of constituent groups.  I felt the process was intense and really forced me to put on my best performance. In hindsight, the day really prepared me for the rigor and diverse issues I encounter in the position today.
Interview Questions: What are the most important issues you will deal with in this position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 panel interviews: one with peers and manager, second with physicians.  All contact was made through HR. There was about a month turn around from when the application was submitted to when I started.  I believe that the process has changed from when I was hired.  Most contact seems to come through the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Describe where you see yourself in 5 years

title: Graduate Student (PhD) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: A month or two after I applied online, the department chair called me and informed me that the program would like for me to interview. They paid for my flight and hotel. The faculty, staff, and current graduate students were friendly and helpful. I was allowed to select 4-5 faculty members with whom I would like to meet. All of my chosen faculty members were able to meet with me except for one, who was out of town. There were 6 meetings that day. 4 of the meetings were with the faculty members I selected, one was with the department chair, and the last meeting was with a member of the selection committee. I was informed of their decision within 6 weeks of the interview. It would have been sooner, but I had apparently been wait-listed.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty straightforward. They asked me about my undergraduate research, why I was interested in the graduate program, and why I thought it would be a good match for me.

title: Associate Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long and comprehensive. I was asked a variety of very specific questions. My references were also asked a number questions regarding my past employment.
Interview Questions: Is it better to complete your work accurately or quickly?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Based on Willingness, grades and ability to communicate. First you need to be accepted by the school and then find a professor which whom you will share your research interests and that is willing and able to guarantee funding during your studies,
Interview Questions: why do you want to become a graduate student?

title: Lead Accountant - UW Madison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Three stages....first, written response to the "exam" which is the actual application part, consisting of three to four or more questions.  The telephone interview came next and they emailed me about an hour before with more questions they wanted to ask.  The telephone interview was with a panel of 3-4 people, and is extremely difficult to gage as you can not read their expressions or body language.  Finally the in person interview was between two groups of four people each time.  And again they emailed me two pages of questions which you can prepare responses to ahead of time.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to deal with a group of difficult people, and what you did to handle them?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to the graduate school, whereas I was in contact with several professors. Once I got accepted I e-mailed the professors of my interest and we got in into the interview process, which was semi formal and relaxing skype interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the research

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth. Our department is small. It's hard to get funding for a PhD Student. We don't have undergraduates, so no TA position available. Sometimes we need to look for fundings from another department.
Interview Questions: Building a profile of real project

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: Responded to ad with job application letter and resume. Called to come for personal interview. Three on One interview with program director and two staff members. Background check. Reference check. Offered job. Accepted and began two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience in technical fields?

title: Administrative Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: Long delays in communication between initial application and interview process. Though I expected a two-step process, there was only one interview held over a half-day with various groups and individuals.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected or creative interview questions.

title: Supervisor Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Applied through student job center, got an email inviting to interview within two weeks. Interviewed the next week and got a response the week after. The process was relax and the interviewers did not make me feel uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: How would you manage a group of college students when you, yourself is a college student?

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: It is a long process, but it is a police department and want to know who they are hiring.  Sometimes it does take them a while to make a decision.  Most people do not make it through the background check because they are not honest about their past.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your Ahha Momnet.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: First send a CV and cover letter to the hiring person, may also need a writing sample. Then wait for an interview. It is also good if you take initiative and make an appointment with him to discuss your qualifications for the position. There are questions like your research interest, your past experience, your programming skills, your recent reading of any books.
Interview Questions: Introduce your project experiences

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: There was a two step interview process. The first round was with two administrative staff and the department chair. The second interview was with two program-affiliated faculty.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was nice talking with the professor in the Materials Science and Engineering. He asked me questions about the ZnO structure and properties. I did a good job. It wasn't very hard.
Interview Questions: What kind of atomic structure dose ZnO has?

title: Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person interview followed by giving a presentation about anything you wanted. They then sat and listened to the presentation and asked questions on your topic to see how you would react.
Interview Questions: A time you failed

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Professors want to know your background, your academic history, most importantly, your past projects and academic research. Choosing a right area that has something to do with your past experience is important. Also, your interests will earn you some credits. Professors need to work with in projects you before they hire you.
Interview Questions: No questions, just do project with him.

title: Associate Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Nothing moves quickly at the university. I applied for the position and didn't receive a response until a month later when they requested a phone interview in two weeks. Being an entry level research position, the phone interview was exactly as I expected - questions that were trying to elicit the degree to which I analyze. After two more weeks, I was contacted and asked to participate in an in-person interview in two weeks. The in-person interview was very informal (I was severely overdressed) and the HR team that I interviewed with were nothing but hospitable and warm. I left with a fairly good feeling, but didn't hear from them for another 2 weeks when they offered me the job. From application to hiring it took three months, and then I wasn't able to start for another month because of their own schedules - this was frustrating.
Interview Questions: All questions were very generic and along the lines of: Describe a time in the workplace where you were confronted with an issue that you needed to fix on-the-fly. How did you approach the situation, and how did you solve the problem.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was interesting. I was hired for an IT position but none of the interviewers had any opinion about my position. They didn't ask the correct questions. They mostly asked about my past experiences and I explained what they need and they didn't need. People were very kind.
Interview Questions: What was your past experience working on the IT projects? Present in a short ppt file

title: Maths TA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. Just apply in the student portal. Lucky guys will be chosen at random from the list of people who posses the required qualification. Among these, the people whose class schedule matches will be selected
Interview Questions: No questions were asked.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: Contacted PI directly to determine if they had a position open and had funding.  Submitted application after verifying funding.  Visited the campus and lab before accepting the position.
Interview Questions: What is your lab experience (not hard).

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. They just ask your work experience, your academic experience, and what your goals are. They may ask you how to do certain tasks such as mix solutions or handle a chemical spill.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would prepare a 100mL solution of 1 M NaCl with (x) grams of solid NaCl.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: apply through a campus career fair and than get a phone interview from Do-it department. The position is software engineer. It takes about 20 mins, talking all about general questions. Nothing too  special, all the questions are pretty easy.
Interview Questions: personality questions, like any experience about detail working.

title: Specimen Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: You apply through the UW-Madison student jobs website, and then one of the PhD students in the lab emails you for an interview. The interview is in-person and consists mostly of the PhD students describing the work in detail.
Interview Questions: Do you have any hunting experience? (the specimens are parasitic worms gathered from pig guts, so candidates need a strong stomach)

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview, just submit online application. Also need 3 letter of recommendations and a statement of purpose. Apply before December, and get results in February. It's not very hard to get in. Tuitions is waived. Stipend is on par with other school, department name is OK. Overall nothing to be complained about.
Interview Questions: Statement of purpose

title: Student Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submit application to the official website. Around 3-5 business days, they will reply with a time for interview. Meet in person . The interview is overall very relaxing. I talked to the supervisor about my class schedule.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with waking up early and clearing snow on the road in the winter?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. I gave them my resume to look over, was asked a few general questions, was given a tour of the facility, and then offered the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the associate dean and two faculty members.  Was fairly casual and friendly since I already knew two of the three interviewers.  They asked specific questions that seemed to be standard and then described the classes I would be teaching.  Now having worked there I think they could have shared more information about expectations that weren't included in the written job description.
Interview Questions: How do you support students from diverse backgrounds

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Interview was scheduled which was not much of an interview in fact.It was to know what kind of work has been done by me in the past and it is upto you to convince the interviewer that you are good enough for the position.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions during the interview.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line and submitted all materials needed. Contacted the professors that you are interested in.
Interview Questions: General Question

title: Student Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions:
Obviously a lot of technical questions about hardware.
Character evaluation, hobbies and interests
Interview Questions: What's the reason behind BSOD? (Blue screen of death)

title: Associate Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume and cover letter to the university, I was contacted by the PI to come meet them for an interview. The interview involved two PIs, two staff scientists and a technician, during which they were all very nice. They asked me about my relevant experience, my skills, and what kind of environment I would like to work in. They asked me specific questions about the research that they were conducting in order to get a sense of how much I knew about the job. After the interview, I received an email asking to summarize two of their recent publications in order to demonstrate that I understood what they were doing. After I submitted my write-up, it took less than a week for them to respond that I'd been hired
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: All I did was email the PI about my interest and he called me in for an interview within the week. Basically I just talked to the PI and he asked me a few questions about my previous position and what I wanted to get out of the experience. Also he asked a couple standard interview questions like "what are your strengths and weaknesses." Since each professor basically runs their own lab I don't think there is any sort of standard hiring process so I don't know how useful this will be to future candidates
Interview Questions: What types of procedures have you done?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Briefly met with professors to discuss job requirements and ability to work with students. They were very nice and helpful. Detailed what I would be doing for the rest of the semester. The overall process was very quick.
Interview Questions: What I found helpful in student assistants that I had in the past.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Informal. Sent an email to inquire about the position. A secretary called me back. I drove in for a 1:1 interview, was given a tour around the laboratory. Was informed later that day that I was hired.
Interview Questions:
What is your GPA?
Are you reliable?

title: Associate SPec Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: just an easy face to face interview. They also asked me some molecular biology questions and personality. First of all, PI face to face interview me and introduce what he's interested in. And then asked me what I did and what's my advantage in my area. He also ask whether I can work dependently or independently, collaboratively with other members.
Interview Questions: How do you evaluate yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Ithaca, NY) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Take the GRE, Apply through graduate school. You have to submit transcripts and letters of recommendation. Process is easier if you know your prospective advisor. It depends on what field you want to go into as far as what GRE scores are accepted. Same for GPA
Interview Questions: GRE questions  and a personal statement, statement of purpose

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume, I was given a brief phone interview. It went well, so I was invited in for an in-person interview. The interviewer was my current supervisor, who gave a very good interview due to his familiarity with the position. He was willing to overlook my lack of qualifications because of some past experience and me "seeming like I could pick up the work quickly."
Interview Questions: What drew you to the UW system?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: applied online through the university job board. Received call about a week later to set up an in person interview. The interview was with two people from the university HR department. Fairly laid back and not intimidating. Asked typical interview questions and were very friendly! great process through out.
Interview Questions: What was one time when you didn't have the necessary information or resources to complete a task and how you handed it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: No specific questions. They only ask you why do you want to work as a research and what are your area/areas of interest and why should we hire you and not someone else. Basic behavioral questions
Interview Questions:
Why research ?
Why you ?
Why this area ?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Individual labs are allowed to interview their own candidates, so each interview will vary by the lab. I met the primary investigator while participating in his research study. He mentioned he was looking for a lab manager/research specialist. This was followed by a more formal interview, but I did not have to interact with HR until he had chosen to hire me, which was convenient.
Interview Questions: Willingness to get additional certifications and job training.

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: not much questions asked, basic DBA and system administration questions.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Peer Advisor, Academic Advising Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Part one: 4-5 candidates were interviewed simultaneously, overseen by their future supervisor. Self-reflections were hand-written by each candidate. All were divided into two groups to focus on critical thinking exercises with possible scenarios they would face should they be offered the position.
Part two: Individual candidates were interviewed by approximately 5 staff members of advising services, each of whom asked questions in quick succession.
Part three: Individual candidates were interviewed by their future supervisor, who asked them final questions.
Interview Questions: Tells us about a time you overcame a challenge.

title: Mobile Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple, given by two lead developers. My interview questions were pretty basic, ranging from a simple search problem, to a recursive function call. I ended up getting the position, and couldn't complain. The pay was decent for a summer job.
Interview Questions: Signed an NDA...

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It is a phone interview with my current advisor through skype. Asked about the basic study in college and basic skills I have. Talked about the job he has and asked whether I'm interested in or not.
Interview Questions: What research did you do in the college

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison
Interview Descriptions: It was a detail oriented interview but it wasn't anything I hadn't experienced before.  They looked into all of the issues and really spent quality time getting to know me which I appreciated.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Housefellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
1st. individual behavioral  a lot about alcohol, your place on campus, thoughts on diversity, how you deal with difficult people or those that need your help
2nd. group problem solving that was basic, need to prove you are a leader and can effectively problem solve
Interview Questions: thoughts on alcohol use and how you deal with it

title: Senior Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: a 2-stage interview process including a phone interview, and a 1/2 day in-person interview. The 1/2 day in-person interview involves a 1 hour Q&A with a search and screen committee, a 1 hour presentation, a written assignment (i.e., demonstrate how you would respond to a series of emails), and a 1 hour interview with the director or an asst director.
Interview Questions: Please describe a couple examples of how you have persuaded others to go along with a project or initiative.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Attended a course with the professor. Took an independent study course the next semester. Did well in both then got offered a research assistantship for the remaining part of my program.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I got call from professor who was asking about my past research experience, background and why I had interest in applying for his team and what I was willing to do if I came over
Interview Questions:
past research experience
what research you have done
relation to professor's potential research area
why you have an interest in applying
no technical question

title: Student Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Quick informal interview to gauge skills and knowledge
Interview Questions: No difficult questions, just basic resume questions

title: Middle School Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: After submitting the application I was called in by the lead tutor for the subject I was applying under. I was asked about my teaching experience both professional and unofficial experiences.  Was then given a test about the basic topics for the subject. I was a science tutor so it reviewed scientific method, cell biology, and with science there was some basic math questions too.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time where you helped someone learn about science or math? What were the challenges? Did you have to use different methods to get them to understand?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I did my graduate work at the University of Madison, Wisconsin so my interview process may be a little different than most. I met my potential new boss after seeing them give a seminar. Asked if I could meet with them at their office, expressed my interest in their research and was asked to come back and give a seminar to their lab.
Interview Questions: What challenges did you overcome in your graduate work?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: your typicall send resume with cover letter.  was given an onsite interview.  follow with a thank you email to employer.  and, received a phone call for an offer.
Interview Questions: What is your background training?

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went in they asked a few questions, and was hired on the spot.  They needed someone to fill the position ASAP, so that is why it was an easy process.  I was referred by someone in another department that I interviewed with, but didn't get the position.  Overall, I am happy that I got the position.
Interview Questions: When can you start working? How many hours?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Openings for graduate teaching assistant position were emailed by the department to the current graduate students. Application instructions were provided. Shortlisted students were interviewed by the corresponding professor for the position.
Interview Questions: Subject knowledge?

title: Economics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through UW-Madison website. Need to include cover letter, resume, and avaibility. Once you got selected, they will call you for an interview. Some behavioral questions and economics related problems were asked during the interview session. Just review your basic Econs 101 and 102 before going to the interview. Good luck.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest  weakness?

title: Summer Research Assistanship Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you must find a professor that is willing to work with you. And then you write a research proposal about the kind of project you and your professor would like to work on. Submit that proposal to the committee then wait.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any interview process, you just need a faculty to recommend you and you have to write a proposal.

title: Director Level Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Search committee hell. Had to do an extensive application, along with the usual cover letter and resume, before having a phone screen and then an all-day interview with various people in various configurations.
Interview Questions: How I had handled difficult situations in the past.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief.  I met one of the interviewers at the front desk and checked in.  I was given a brief tour of the facilities, and then we went into an office for the interview.  I was interviewed by two individuals, for approximately forty-five minutes. Both interviewers were pleasant, and the interview felt somewhat relaxed.
Interview Questions: Give an instance when you had to deal with a difficult co-worker, and how you handled the situation.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The professor sent out emails and I replied with my cv. We sent up a meeting by email and meet in person the same week. Talked happily for an hour and received the offer the next day by email.
Interview Questions: What did you do in your masters?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: No actual interview I had before I got the position. After I sent my C.V.. she scheduled on-site interview. I present my research and met lab members. Truly said, I didn't have an actual interview. I got the job by my C.V. and publications I involved.
Interview Questions: She didn't asked specific questions. She explain about the project I will involved.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Open house interview. First someone will introduce the whole process of the interview. Different groups will introduce their research. Then the student will go to different office to meet their potential adviser. Different professors have very different questions. Then the student representatives will hang out with students for dinner. They will give feedback to adviser how they think about individual students
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Spoke for 20 minutes and got the position.  I emailed to get the appointment. Then explained my background and experience. I showed my resume and transcript and talked about the project.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with your hand before (experimental). ...

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone interview for some background question and then onsite interview for presentation for the communication skills, talk with each group members test the personality, communication skills and to see whether you are a person to work with others easily. what's your expect salary?
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your background?
collaboration experience
do you want to move to madison

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I presented my works at a seminar and met with faculty and scientists and had a quick lab tour. Finally I had a casual dinner with two faculty members. Everyone was very nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: My research interests, questions related to my past research

title: Biophysics Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone interview: one of the program trainers asked my background, research experience, questions about research. Also depending on the experience I had, she asked questions in related areas, but not what I was doing. She also introduce the program details and how the rotation works.
Interview Questions: What research experience do you have?

title: University Services Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: I took the Civil Service Exam and applied on the government job website.  Because my score was among the top few for the position at the time, I was offered a phone interview.  Traditional behavioral questions.  I interviewed for two different departments at the time, and questions were very similar.  It was after I started working here that I realized if it was not because nobody wanted to transfer to the position, I would not have had a chance.  The department that I work for had an opening for the USA II position, but the department had to accept an internal transfer, so the position was never even posted externally.
Interview Questions: It wasn't difficult at all.  If you are prepared for a normal interview, you will be prepared for the interview of this position.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume to a postdoc in a group that was hiring, no online submission to the UW system.  Had a phone interview with the supervisor and two post docs, then onsite interview where I met with most of the research group and received a lab tour.  I did not have to give a presentation, all though I think that was a personal preference, and not a university wide standard.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this field of research?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was originally interviewed as a undergraduate student hourly, and then promoted to Research Assistant (50%) during grad school and Assistant Researcher (100%) after graduation. I did not re-interview for the later positions, so I'm noting my interview for the undergraduate position.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite organ of the body and why?

title: Associate Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Job listings are on the University of Wisconsin Madison web site.  Typical process:  submit cover letter and resume to the contact for the job.  Called back for one interview after review of submission.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison (Madison, WI) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview, got an onsite interview which need to do a presentation about my work.
Interview Questions: they were all easy questions about my previous work.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Wisconsin-Madison in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Well, I guess the hiring process was getting into the program in Political Science. I attended the prospective student orientation and decided to give it a go. Knowing that I would be a TA in American politics came later. It was weird since I don't have a background in American politics, but whatever.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to graduate school?
